column4: I know its not an Ubuntu issue, but my computer has problems with overheating. At normal usage (browsing internet, playing music) i have no issues. But if i ran seti or other programs that uses the system alot, it overheats and shutdown. What would be the most rational to do? Should i buy a new CPU fan, or should i invest in one of those chassi-fans?
prego, its an amd XP 2400+.  So a chassi-fan will not make any difference?
it might, but CPU fan is most important.
